Record of Scriptures with Titles but Missing Originals, Part 5. Preface states:
Since the Buddha's scriptures flowed to China,
For more than six hundred years,
They have been destroyed three times.
Those who promoted and protected them observed the situation and acted accordingly.
First, they hid in mountain caves and firmly upheld the ultimate truth.
They were soaked by clouds and mist and further rotted.
Later, when the Dharma was revived, they searched for the lost scriptures.
Out of a hundred, not one was preserved.
They only kept the main points.
Fortunately, during the five dynasties of the Jiangnan region, the faith was not damaged.
Thus, the Dharma texts were transmitted and circulated throughout the world.

The translators suffered difficulties and died without a place to rest.
